result.execSummary:
The defendant Clarisa Ann Zamora was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.  Extradition Fees in the amount of $400.00 ordered for transport via WI Lock & Load Prisoner Transports LLC from Lake Co, Indiana.
Time Served Sentence with Good Time and credit for prior time served of 59 days.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clarisa Ann Zamora

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

ADDRESS INFO for Clarisa Ann Zamora
Current: 6200 Glen Drive, Merrillville, IN 46410 United States  (Effective: 01-21-2016)
Prior: 4860 N Cote Ave, East Chicago, IN 46312 United States

Case Called @ 2:50 PM: Defendant Clarisa Ann Zamora in court with attorney John B. Selsing, both appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by DA.  Defendant and counsel concur w/State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty. Elements of offense explained in detail.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts State's Motion to Amend to allege the offense of DC w/Armed w/Dangerous Weapon, contrary to s. 947.01 and 939.63(1)(a) Class B Misd Plea:  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Accepts resolution and Imposes:  Jail sentence of 78 days - GT and TS credit of 59 days - time served sentence; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP, Costs to include $400 Extradition Fees.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-20-2016 02:45 pm

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney John B. Selsing in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Selsing requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:28 PM: Defendant Clarisa Ann Zamora in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 03:05 pm.

Defendant and SPD Sziliagyi

Case Called @ 1:30 PM:  Defendant Clarisa Ann Zamora in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.   Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def failed to appear on 10/12/15 for an IA.  Court notes cash bond has been forfeited due to nonappearance.  Per ADA:  Def currently residing in Indiana - State requests an add'l cash bond being imposed.  SPD argues as to bond request.  States co-defendant residing now in Texas and the case is also in warrant status.  Requests Court impose a minimum cash bond.  The Court: Affirms Riverside Ruling previously made.  Orders Cash Bond of $1000.00 w/conditions.  IA Scheduled.  SPD confirms eligibility.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Fax from WCSD advising that the defendant is in custody in Indiana

Case called @ 2:12 p.m. Defendant Clarisa Ann Zamora not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court authorizes the issuance of an arrest warrant extraditable within the Continental United States. The court orders the $500 cash bond posted forfeited. The court notes that the defendant filed a letter earlier but has not shown good cause for an adjournment.

Case called @ 1:10 p.m. Defendant Clarisa Ann Zamora in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. ADA Anderson requesting low cash bond or sig bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting Sig Bond. Court orders $500 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
